DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Regional Lymph Node N Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for colon and rectal carcinoma based on evidence obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Questionnaire Domain Colorectal Neoplasm Clinical N Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire._Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. wz

ValueDomain.preferredName: Colorectal Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 N Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of colorectal cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. Adenocarcinomas, high-grade neuroendocrine carcinomas, and squamous cell carcinomas of the colon and rectum are covered by this staging system. Appendiceal carcinomas, anal carcinomas, and well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors (carcinoids) are not covered by this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer pN2b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer pN2b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer in which seven or more regional lymph nodes are positive. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pN2b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer in which seven or more regional lymph nodes are positive. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer pN2a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer pN2a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer in which four to six regional lymph nodes are positive. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pN2a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer in which four to six regional lymph nodes are positive. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer in which four or more regional lymph nodes are positive. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer in which four or more regional lymph nodes are positive. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer pN1c TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer pN1c TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer in which no regional lymph nodes are positive, but there are tumor deposits in the subserosa, mesentery, or nonperitonealized pericolic, or perirectal/mesorectal tissues. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pN1c TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer in which no regional lymph nodes are positive, but there are tumor deposits in the subserosa, mesentery, or nonperitonealized pericolic, or perirectal/mesorectal tissues. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer pN1b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer pN1b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer in which two or three regional lymph nodes are positive. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pN1b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer in which two or three regional lymph nodes are positive. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer pN1a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer pN1a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer in which one regional lymph node is positive. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pN1a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer in which one regional lymph node is positive. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer in which one to three regional lymph nodes are positive (tumor in lymph nodes measuring 0.2 mm or more), or any number of tumor deposits are present and all identifiable lymph nodes are negative. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer in which one to three regional lymph nodes are positive (tumor in lymph nodes measuring 0.2 mm or more), or any number of tumor deposits are present and all identifiable lymph nodes are negative. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer with no metastasis to regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with no metastasis to regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
